name: LEAD RAIN
effect: After firing its Quad Assault Cannons, the Deluge may create a lead rain zone in the same Line 10 as a free action. This zone ends immediately if the Deluge moves, is destroyed, becomes STUNNED or JAMMED, or if it fires the weapon again. When a character enters this zone for the first time in a round (but not if they start their turn in it), the Deluge automatically deals the Quad Assault Cannons’ RELIABLE damage to them.

name: SPIN UP
effect: While the Deluge is in the DANGER ZONE, its Quad Assault Cannons deal +2 bonus damage, and their RELIABLE value is increased by 1.

name: REACTIVE DEFENCE SYSTEM
effect: The Deluge and adjacent allies gain soft cover for as long as it’s generating a zone of lead rain.

name: MATHUR STOP
effect: When the Deluge clears all Heat, it may choose to receive Heat equal to half its Heat Cap, putting it in the DANGER ZONE.

name: POINT DEFENSE MODE
effect: The Deluge reorients its frame and shifts into point-defense mode. Until the start of its next turn, the Deluge becomes IMMOBILIZED and can’t take normal actions, but it projects a Burst 3 point defense zone around itself. This zone is a lead rain zone that only damages hostiles, instead providing the Deluge and its allies with soft cover and RESISTANCE to damage from ranged attacks.

name: SHEER VOLUME OF BULLETS
effect: Attacks with the Deluge’s Quad Assault Cannons ignore INVISIBLE.

name: SPRAY AND PRAY
effect: Until the start of its next turn, the Deluge’s Quad Assault Cannons gain INACCURATE, but their attack and the lead rain zone they generate become Cone 7.

name: WITHERING HAIL
effect: Hostile characters within the Deluge’s Lead Rain zone become IMPAIRED, and can’t clear this condition by any means while they remain in the zone.

name: Mining Charge
effect: The Lobber can use this weapon as both parts of a BARRAGE, but the target areas can’t overlap.

name: BLAST PLATING
effect: The Lobber has RESISTANCE to Explosive damage and damage from Blast attacks and systems.

name: INTERESTING CHOICE FOR CQB
effect: The Lobber doesn’t receive DIFFICULTY on Mining Charge attacks due to being ENGAGED if it includes itself in the Blast

name: PULL THE PIN!
effect: When the Lobber’s mech is destroyed, it immediately makes two Mining Charge attacks. Both of these attacks gain +1 ACCURACY and must include the Lobber in their Blast; this isn’t a BARRAGE, so the areas may overlap. The pilot may EJECT as part of this process, and definitely should.

name: EXPERT DEMOLITIONIST
effect: Objects, terrain and DEPLOYABLES in the area of the Lobber's Mining Charge attacks are automatically hit and take 5 ENERGY AP.

name: Assault Launcher
effect: The next Mining Charge attack the Lobber makes becomes Range 15. Any Blast remains the same.

name: Incendiary Charge
effect: The next Mining Charge attack the Lobber makes deals 3/4/5 Burn instead of its regular damage.

name: Kinetic Charge
effect: The next Mining Charge attack the Lobber makes gains Knockback 2

name: Seismic Charge
effect: Any targets the Lobber hits with its next Mining Charge attack must succeed on a HULL save or be knocked PRONE.

name: VALHALLA!
effect: The Lobber’s final Mining Charge attacks during Pull the Pin! are Blast 2, deal +1d6 bonus damage and can be used even if the Lobber’s Mining Charge has been destroyed.

name: ANOMALOUS MOTION
effect: The Parallel teleports when it makes a standard move.

name: PHASE ECHO
effect: Whenever the Parallel teleports, it creates an echo in the space it previously occupied. An echo is an obstruction the same size as the Parallel, has EVASION 10, E-DEFENSE 10, is destroyed if it takes any damage or heat, and projects the same THREAT as the Parallel’s weapons. The Parallel can only have one echo at once; creating a new one destroys the old one. The Parallel also gains the REVERT and ACHRONAL RESPONSE reactions.

name: Revert
effect: The Parallel interrupts the triggering attack and teleports to the space of one of its echoes, destroying it. The attack now targets the new echo it left behind. If part of the same attack also targeted its previous echo, it now targets the Parallel.
trigger: A melee or ranged attack is made against the Parallel.

name: Achronal Response
effect: The Parallel immediately teleports to the echo’s space, destroying it, and then triggers OVERWATCH as part of the same reaction, before the hostile character moves.
trigger: A hostile character starts movement (including BOOST and other actions) inside the THREAT of one of the Parallel’s echoes.

name: Cracked Mirror
effect: The attacker must makes a SYSTEMS save. If it fails, the attack doesn’t happen and the attacker and the target swap position, both teleporting. The attacker must then repeat the attack against themselves.
trigger: A melee or ranged attack is made against the Parallel or one of its echoes.

name: DEATHWALKER
effect: The first time that the Parallel is destroyed each combat, if they still have an echo active, they’re not actually defeated. At the start of the Parallel’s next turn, they teleport to their echo, destroying it and returning to 1 HP. If their last echo is destroyed before their next turn, this trait doesn't function and the Parallel remains destroyed. This doesn’t stack with the VETERAN template’s FEIGN DEATH trait

name: SHATTER
effect: Whenever an echo is destroyed, it deals 3/6/9 KINETIC in a Burst 1 area.

name: Doppler
effect: The Parallel may move one of its echoes up to 5 spaces. Echoes are not characters, so this movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.

name: Uncertainty
effect: The Parallel can have two echoes active at once, instead of one. It always decides which of its previous echoes to destroy if it creates a third. If this system is destroyed, an echo of the Parallel’s choice is also destroyed, even if it only has one left.

name: Wraith Pistol
effect: This weapon makes one extra attack per echo the Parallel has active. Each extra attack originates from a different one of its echoes.

name: COOL HAND
effect: The Slinger gains ACCURACY instead of DIFFICULTY from being ENGAGED.

name: DEATHMARK
effect: When the Slinger scores a critical hit, their target gains Deathmark. A character with Deathmark can make an AGILITY save as a quick action to remove it.

name: SUN'S ZENITH
effect: Choose any number of characters within line of sight and Range 8 of the Slinger. They each gain Deathmark.

name: Ring The Bell
effect: The Slinger makes a Hand Cannon attack against each character with Deathmark, then clears Deathmark on those characters. Any character hit by these attacks becomes IMPAIRED until the end of their next turn. Attacks that score a critical hit can reapply Deathmark

name: ANALOG TARGETING
effect: The Slinger can make ranged attacks while JAMMED

name: Another Hand Cannon
effect:
When the Slinger makes an OVERWATCH attack with another weapon, they can also make an attack with this weapon against the triggering character.

This weapon is considered a Hand Cannon for any traits or systems that refer to one.

name: Draw!
effect: Clear that character’s Deathmark. Until the end of their turn, that character receives +3 DIFFICULTY on any attack that doesn’t target the Slinger.
trigger: A character with Deathmark starts their turn within line of sight and Range 8 of the Slinger.

name: Dark Wind
effect: The Slinger makes a Hand Cannon attack against that character. If the triggering character has Deathmark, clear it, and the Slinger’s attack happens first.
trigger: A character attacks the Slinger with a ranged weapon.

name: Fan The Hammer
effect: The Slinger prepares to unleash a hail of lead. The next attack it makes with its Hand Cannon becomes Cone 5, but doesn’t hit allied characters.

name: Shouldna Aughta
effect: That character gains Deathmark. At TIER 2, this reaction can be used twice per round. At TIER 3, it can be used three times per round.
trigger: A hostile character within line of sight of the Slinger attacks one of the Slinger’s allies.

name: THE DEVIL’S EYE
effect: The Slinger ignores HIDDEN and INVISIBLE on any character that has Deathmark.

name: TRUE GRIT
effect: When a character with Deathmark attacks the Slinger, the Slinger gains RESISTANCE to damage, Heat and Burn from that attack. Then, clear that character’s Deathmark.
